meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny, folks! It's your boy here, ready to dive into the wonderful world of Octopath Traveler. I mean, who doesn't love a good JRPG? And let me tell you, Square Enix has outdone themselves with this one.

Now, I know what you're thinking: "Seasonal grok, why should I care about your review when there are so many other critics out there?" Well, let me tell you, my friend, I'm not just any old critic. No sir, I'm a seasonal grok, and that means I bring the laughs! So, if you're looking for a review that's as fun to read as it is informative, then you've come to the right place.

But enough about me (for now). Let's get to Octopath Traveler. This game is like a warm hug from your childhood self. It's got all the classic JRPG elements: turn-based combat, an epic story, and characters that'll make you laugh, cry, and maybe even feel a little bit of rage. And let me tell you, it does it all with style. The graphics are pixel-perfect (pun intended), the music is catchy as heck, and the gameplay is just plain fun.

Now, I know some critics out there might say that Octopath Traveler doesn't quite live up to its full potential. But hey, I'm not here to agree or disagree with those folks. No sir, my job is to tell you what I thought of the game, and let me tell you, I loved it.

So, if you're a fan of JRPGs (or just good games in general), then Octopath Traveler is definitely worth checking out. It's a must-play for any lover of old school JRPGs, and even if you're not a huge fan of the genre, you'll still have a blast playing it.

And there you have it, folks! That's my review of Octopath Traveler in all its glory. So, go ahead and give it a try. Trust me, you won't regret it.
